sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: In the midst of its invasion of Ukraine, Russia has been putting the final touches to rehearsals for its Victory Day parade in Moscow.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The annual show of strength marks the Soviet defeat of Nazi Germany in World War II, referred to by Russia as the Great Patriotic War.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Thousands of soldiers usually march across Red Square in the capital, followed by tanks, armoured vehicles and missile launchers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Despite predictions of a swift victory, Monday's parade will take place during the third month of what the Kremlin calls Russia's special military operation in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Observers have been surprised and impressed at the level of resistance of Ukrainian forces, and some experts are saying Russia has faced some severe losses as the war drags on.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Vladimir Putin is expected to deliver a speech at Monday's event. Some Western officials say he may declare all-out war on Ukraine or announce mobilization across the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The US First Lady Jill Biden and her Romanian counterpart, Carmen Ioannis, visited a school in Bucharest on Saturday where Ukrainian refugee children are being educated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Two thousand such children have signed up to attend classes in Romanian schools.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: As well as education authorities, the two first ladies talked with Ukrainian teachers and mothers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01

sentences.sentence: And it's just amazing that the Romanian people have taken you into their homes and into their hearts and I think that's made all the difference for all of you." sentences.sentence: Afghanistan's Taliban rulers have ordered all Afghan women to wear head-to-toe clothing in public in a sharp turn towards a more hardline enforcement of religious rules.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The Taliban's vice and virtue ministry said only women's eyes should be visible in public and that the use of the head-to-toe burqa was the best way to ensure compliance.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Women who don't wear the hijab firstly should be identified and their guardians should be

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: advised and the women themselves should be punished, Ministry official Shir Mohamed said.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Secondly, their guardians should be brought to the relevant department for explanation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Thirdly, their guardians should be jailed for three days.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Fourthly, their guardians should be tried and punished accordingly.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Iraq is in the midst of a severe drought that some experts believe is driven by climate change.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The country's 41 million people are feeling the effects on a daily basis, in the form of depleted rivers, desertification and more intense sandstorms.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And now they're facing food shortages and rising prices, as this year's harvest is at risk.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: ARAB AL-KHALIL, Iraqi President of the United States, Right now, my family and I are at a loss on how to keep living.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: We won't be able to plant anything next year if things don't change.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: An agriculture ministry spokesman said in 2019 and 2020, wheat harvests reached 5 million tons, enough to guarantee self-sufficiency for Iraq.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: But this year, it's likely to be just half that, not enough to feed the country for a year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Iraq will have to import grain, just as Russia's invasion of Ukraine pushes up prices.
